messages.title: Neil Coyle - Keeping his promises
messages.content: In 2015 I made a promise. I promised to stand by our community and never vote for something that I knew would hurt local people. I'm proud to say that I kept my promise. I will always put local people first. On Thursday 8 June we have an important choice. We can't go back to the broken promises of the past. We need a Labour MP who will vote against Brexit, not a Lib Dem who will do a deal with the Tories. So I promise to stand by our community and oppose the Tories and Brexit - and I keep my promises.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: I’ll always stand by our community
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will continue to oppose Brexit under any circumstances.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: I’ll keep fighting for genuinely affordable homes
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Housing is my number one priority and always will be.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: I’ll stand up for health and care services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will continue to champion free health and care services for all.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: I’ll keep opposing Tory cuts to education
keyPolicies.policyDescription: I’ll stay focused on giving Southwark kids the best education and opportunities.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: I’ll continue to stay strong on policing and defence
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Your family’s safety is important to me. I will always put you and your family first.

issues.brexitEurope: I will continue to oppose Brexit under any circumstances.
issues.defence: I’ll continue to stay strong on policing and defence.
issues.education: I’ll keep opposing Tory cuts to education. I’ll stay focused on giving Southwark kids the best education and opportunities.
issues.health: I’ll stand up for health and care services.

community.content: I’ll always stand by our community. I will continue to oppose Brexit under any circumstances.

examples: Lib Dem Hughes voted for the Bedroom Tax 8 times despite it hitting thousands of local families.
Lib Dems break their promises - they cannot be trusted.
Lib Dem Hughes turned his back on our community and supported the Tory-led Coalition every step of the way.
I’ll keep fighting for genuinely affordable homes. Housing is my number one priority and always will be.
I will continue to oppose Brexit under any circumstances.
I’ll stand up for health and care services. I will continue to champion free health and care services for all.

Lib Dems got into bed with the Tories - and will do it again. Lib Dem Hughes voted with the Tories nearly a thousand times. He turned his back on our community and supported the Tory-led Coalition every step of the way.
Lib Dems break their promises - they cannot be trusted. Despite claiming to be pro-EU, 22% of Lib Dem MPs failed to oppose triggering Article 50.
Lib Dems backed the Tories' hated Bedroom Tax. Lib Dem Hughes voted for the Bedroom Tax 8 times despite it hitting thousands of local families.
